name: Affective Systems
description: Affective Systems are responsible for processing and responding to both aversive and positive motivational situations or contexts, encompassing emotional responses such as fear, anxiety, reward seeking, and mood regulation.

subdomains.name: Threat and Risk Evaluation
subdomains.description: Threat and Risk Evaluation is the process of assessing the potential for harm or loss.

subdomains.name: Reward Responsiveness
subdomains.description: Reward Responsiveness is the degree to which an individual is likely to respond to rewards.

subdomains.name: Habit
subdomains.description: Habit is a routine of behavior that is repeated regularly and tends to occur subconsciously. Relates to compulsive behavior.

subdomains.name: Volition
subdomains.description: Volition is the cognitive process by which an individual decides on and commits to a particular course of action.

subdomains.name: Positive Affect
subdomains.description: Positive Affect is a relatively long lasting emotional state associated with positive feelings and well-being.

subdomains.name: Impulse Control
subdomains.description: Impulse Control is the ability to resist or delay an impulse, drive, or temptation to act.

subdomains.name: Other Inhibitory Systems
subdomains.description: Other subdomains related to responses to aversive situations and inhibition of behavior.

subdomains.name: Other Positive Valence Systems
subdomains.description: Other subdomains related to responses to positive motivational situations or contexts.

name: Cognitive Systems
description: Cognitive Systems are responsible for various cognitive processes.

subdomains.name: Executive Function
subdomains.description: Executive Function is a set of cognitive processes that are necessary for the cognitive control of behavior, including working memory, reasoning, task flexibility, problem solving, and attention control.

subdomains.name: Perception
subdomains.description: Perception is the organization, identification, and interpretation of sensory information in order to represent and understand the environment.

subdomains.name: Memory
subdomains.description: Memory is the faculty of the brain by which information is encoded, stored, and retrieved when needed.

subdomains.name: Language
subdomains.description: Language is a system of communication that uses symbols to convey information.

subdomains.name: Sense of Self
subdomains.description: Sense of Self is a system that represents the individual’s experience of being a separate and distinct entity that is continuous in time and space.

subdomains.name: Reality Monitoring
subdomains.description: Reality Monitoring is a cognitive system that is responsible for discriminating between internally generated information and information that arises from external sources.

subdomains.name: Emotional Processing
subdomains.description: Emotional Processing is the process of recognizing, understanding, and responding to emotions in oneself and others.

subdomains.name: Other
subdomains.description: Other Cognitive Systems

name: Social Processes
description: Systems for Social Processes mediate responses to interpersonal settings of various types, including perception and interpretation of others’ actions.

name: Arousal and Regulatory Systems
description: Arousal/Regulatory Systems are responsible for generating activation of neural systems as appropriate for various contexts, and providing appropriate homeostatic regulation of such systems as energy balance and sleep.

subdomains.name: Sleep
subdomains.description: Sleep is a naturally recurring state characterized by reduced or absent consciousness, relatively suspended sensory activity, and inactivity of nearly all voluntary muscles.

subdomains.name: Consciousness
subdomains.description: Consciousness is the state or quality of awareness, or, of being aware of an external object or something within oneself.

subdomains.name: Autonomic and Homeostatic Functions
subdomains.description: Homeostasis is the property of a system in which variables are regulated so that internal conditions remain stable and relatively constant.

subdomains.name: Epilepsy
subdomains.description: Epilepsy is a group of neurological disorders characterized by epileptic seizures.

subdomains.name: Other
subdomains.description: Other Arousal/Regulatory Systems

name: Sensory Systems
description: Sensory Systems are responsible for processing sensory information from the body and the environment.

subdomains.name: Somatosensory
subdomains.description: Somatosensory is the system that is responsible for the processing of sensory information from the body.

subdomains.name: Vestibular
subdomains.description: Vestibular is the system that provides the leading contribution to the sense of balance and spatial orientation for the purpose of coordinating movement with balance.

subdomains.name: Spatial
subdomains.description: Spatial is the system that is responsible for the processing of spatial information.

subdomains.name: Proprioception
subdomains.description: Proprioception is the sense of the relative position of one's own parts of the body and strength of effort being employed in movement.

subdomains.name: Visual
subdomains.description: Visual is the system that is responsible for the processing of visual information.

subdomains.name: Auditory
subdomains.description: Auditory is the system that is responsible for the processing of auditory information.

subdomains.name: Olfactory
subdomains.description: Olfactory is the system that is responsible for the processing of olfactory information.

subdomains.name: Gustatory
subdomains.description: Gustatory is the system that is responsible for the processing of gustatory information.

name: Motor Systems
description: Motor Systems are primarily responsible for the control and execution of motor behaviors, and their refinement during learning and development.

subdomains.name: Gross Motor
subdomains.description: Gross Motor is the movement of the large muscles of the body.

subdomains.name: Fine Motor
subdomains.description: Fine Motor is the movement of small muscles, such as those in the fingers and hands.

subdomains.name: Oculomotor
subdomains.description: Oculomotor is the control of eye movements.
